intro: Tanacetum chinense, commonly known as Chinese tansy, is a flowering plant native to China and parts of East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and aromatic, fern-like foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Tanacetum chinense is often used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
